message: @TonyPotter new gui classes are pushed and ready for you.  Any changes to GUI have to be made by opening the class with WindowsBuilder editor only not the normal java editor. (right click>open with>windowsbuilder).  Non gui code can be added in default editor.
@OmarRamos I will look at Project class.
@MuraliRaju Thank you!
@all can we get together and plan out tasks for each of us.  Appears like Tony is still tied up with the family thing.
i am working on writing the codes for the team & teams class, i should have something to show for by tomorrow

@MuraliRaju If you're able to sort out the initialize() method for me in the Project class I should be able to apply the same or a similar approach in the Assignment(s) and Rating(s) classes too. The main issue I had been running into was just the debugger not behaving for me so if you run into that same "ClassNotFoundException" let me know.
Is the GUI already working or is it stubbed out with example data?
(I'm just wondering since we haven't built the other classes out yet so I'm not sure how it's pulling in data yet)
Also, what's the best way to test/run the GUI so we can try it out?
@OmarRamos GUI does not have data.  @TonyPotter  was going to provide the data methods.  If we dont hear from Tony by tomorrow we will have to plan for data integration.

Once we have Team(s) and Project(s) going we should have most of it available and the others (Assignment(s) and Rating(s)) should come pretty quickly after that and should provide the methods you need for the data integration I believe.
We additionally have for extra credit this week extending GradesDB and implementing the interface they provided and have it handle the additional functionality they described.
@OmarRamos to test GUI  you should be able to run the GUIcontroller class which has a main in it.
you can also check the design in the design tab in the windowbuilder editor.
Is the GUIController class new?
Yes.  Pull again - I added Save button.
That's it for tonight.
